div.l: A thef he was for sothe of corn ⁊and mele
And that a sly ⁊and vsyng for to stele
His nome was hote deynous Symkyn
A wyf he had comen of nolle kyn
The person of the town hur fader was
Wᵗith hur͗e he yaf a panne of bras
For that symkyn in his blod shulde ally
Sheo was fostered in a Nonnery
For symkyn wolde no wyf as he sayde
But sheo were wel norysshed ⁊and a mayde
To saue his estate in yomanrye
And sheo was proud ⁊and pert as a pye
A full feyre sight was hit on hem two
On holy dayes by fore hur wolde he go
Wᵗith his typet wounde a boute his hed
And sheo come after in a gyde of red
And symkyn had hosen of the same
Ther durst no wight clepe hur but madame
Was non so hardy that wente bi the wey
That wᵗith hur͗e durst rage or ones pley
But he wolde ben slayn of symkyn
Wᵗith panade or wᵗith knyf or wᵗith bodkyn
For Ielous folk ben perelous euer mo
Algate thei wolde hur wyues wende so
And eke for sheo was somdell smoterlyche
Sheo was as deyne as water in dyche
And full of hoker ⁊and bisemare
Hur thought a lady shulde hur spare
What for hur kynrede what for hur norterye
That sheo had lerned in the Nonnerye
¶ A douthter had thei bi twene hem two
Of · xx · yere wᵗith oute eny mo ennabling collatio
